msContents.summary: F-56v: Sword of the Trinity, Säyfä Śǝllase, ሠይፈ፡ ሥላሴ፡. Arranged for days of the week. AbbCat 244, , Notice 106; StrLin 53 and 62; Textes 226–38.; EMML 1170 and EMIP 7. See ሰይፈ፡ ሥላሴ። ወመልክአ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ዘደረሰ፡ አባ፡ ስብሐት፡ ለአብ፡ (Addis Ababa: Täsfa, 1947 E.C.), arranged for the days of the week: Introduction (1r), Monday (10r), Tuesday (), Wednesday (), Thursday (), Friday (), Saturday (), Sunday (). Each day ends with a miracle of the Trinity: Monday (15v), Tuesday (), Wednesday (), Thursday (), Friday (), Saturay (), Sunday (). F-66r: Image of the Trinity, Mälk‘a Śǝllase, መልክአ፡ ሥላሴ፡. Répertoire 20; MG 189ff. Incipit : ሰላም፡ ለህላዌክሙ፡ ዘይመውዕ፡ ህላውያተ፡. F-xxx: Prayer to the Trinity for Peace, “Praise to you, Holy Trinity,” ግናይ ለክሙ ሥሉስ ቅዱስ, written by Giyorgis of Gassacha. iv-ii r Asmat prayer for protection against illness, written in pencil and a later hand. F, 43v, and 66r mention the name of the original owner, ኃይለ ሚካኤል, which has been erased in most cases but was missed here. and passim mention the name of a secondary owner, ወልደ ሥላሴ, written over the name of the primary owner whose name has been erased. mentions one ገብረ ማርያም, who may be the scribe.
